main event: On August 6, 1957, a yellow pulsating light was observed over the Dry Tortugas, Florida, with an estimated altitude of 50,000 feet and a speed of approximately 1500 knots.
interesting points: The object appeared stationary during observation and was likely caused by ground reflection, possibly a flare or unidentified object., The sighting lasted for about 5 minutes., There was no other aircraft or indication of activity in the area at the time., The report includes various hypotheses regarding the nature of the object: possibly aircraft, balloons, or flares., The observation was recorded using ground radar with no other indications found nearby.
